section.title: Using the Plugin
section.para: The plugin contains 3 main panels: a list of workflow runs, the workflow diagram and the results (visible after running or testing a workflow). There are also 6 buttons: Preferences, Test, Run, Reset Diagram, Zoom In & Zoom Out.

Test allows you to perform a workflow healthcheck. This will check that the workflow can be translated from the old style scufl model to the T2 style and that any web-service endpoints are responding.
Preferences allows you to select a location for the data manager to store the entities, this is also remembered between plugin sessions.

Run pops up a panel which allows you to enter the inputs for the workflow. Clicking on run will execute the workflow with your inputs and then present them in the bottom right panel. The data manager will have registered any inputs and any results and the serialised versions can be browsed on disk.
The sample input data below shows a list containing a Data Document (with a File Reference Scheme & a Http Reference Scheme), a Literal Blob (>80 characters) and an Integer Literal.

Clicking on the Run button executes the workflow. The workflow run is added to the list of workflows and the result panel is opened. During the run the workflow status is monitored and shown on the diagram. In the example below the seqret, emma and plot processors are in progress; the number of complete iterations is shown in the top right of the processor box.
If a processor fails to run the border of the processor box changes colour to red and the number of failed iterations is shown in the bottom right of the box.
As the workflow runs results are displayed in the Results panel.
